report_title: IBISWorld | Auto Windshield Repair Services in the US Mar 2024
executive_summary: Auto windshield repair service providers primarily engage in replacing, repairing and tinting automotive glass. While some repairs are essential for vehicle safety, the majority of repairs, replacements and tinting jobs rely on economic conditions. Strong per capita disposable income and consumer confidence will encourage nonessential auto windshield repair services. Consumers may defer repairs during periods of economic uncertainty. Even so, large companies managed to carry revenue through the pandemic, relying on value-added services, like mobile replacements, to generate revenue. Revenue ballooned at an expected CAGR of 4.4% to $8.5 billion through the current period, including a 0.9% jump in 2024, where profit reached 13.2%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Most states deemed car repair shops, including auto windshield repair services, essential during the pandemic, permitting these businesses to remain open amid quarantine and lockdown restrictions. Still, lower driving activity and depressed driving activity encouraged consumers to delay nonessential repairs. Larger auto windshield repair services largely carried growth through the pandemic; these providers often offer value-added services with greater convenience, like mobile repairs, enabling them to capture more market share and protect against downturns.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Supply chain disruptions challenged auto windshield repair services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Long lead times for upstream glass manufacturers following the pandemic and the Russian invasion of Ukraine created rippling supply chain disruptions. Auto glass prices climbed significantly, threatening bottom lines. Many windshield repair shops, especially those with lower economies of scale, reported multiple-week backorders for windshields and windows, with prices for related sealants and auto parts also skyrocketing. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, motor vehicle part prices increased 5.2%, while adhesives and sealant costs ballooned 14.2% between 2021 and 2022.

As federal, state and local governments lifted lockdown restrictions following the pandemic, many consumers expressed pent-up demand for entertainment, travel and other recreation options. This trend contributed to a notable uptick in driving activity. In particular, motor vehicle registrations, car sales and vehicle miles skyrocketed in 2021. Increased driving activity also caused vehicle accidents to climb more than 16.0% in the same year. Similarly, higher new car prices encouraged buyers to switch to used vehicles; used cars are more likely to require windshield replacements before sale, boosting demand for auto repair services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Advancing driver-assistance systems (ADAS) will alter the industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry's potential customer base is expanding, highlighted by more motor vehicle registrations through the outlook period. Even so, more cars manufactured with advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) will reduce the total number of vehicle collisions. For example, automakers and safety regulators estimate that cars outfitted with forward collision warning and automatic emergency braking will lower rear-end collisions by more than 49.0%. Similarly, these safety systems will limit the severity of most collisions, potentially reducing damage to windshields and making expensive replacements less common.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Advanced windshields will carry higher replacement costs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Advanced windshields often require sensors and cameras embedded into auto glass, making the process of replacing a windshield more complex and costly. Repairers often turn to aftermarket parts to reduce costs, but many top car manufacturers, like Ford and Honda, advise against aftermarket windshields in cars fitted with ADAS. Even so, companies have been able to charge consumers and insurance more for advanced windshield repair and replacement. Kelly Blue Book has reported that ADAS windshield repair costs have eclipsed $1,000 for replacements, averaging $1,600 for advanced models. By comparison, traditional windshield repairs cost $300 to $500.

Steady revenue growth will encourage companies to enter the industry through the outlook period; in particular, many auto body shops span multiple auto repair service industries. Many companies, particularly small businesses and nonemployers, will join franchises to gain access to a wider network and more resources. Even so, small, regional repair shops will struggle against Safelite and other large franchises. Consumers have increasingly preferred convenience, preferring same-day mobile services; most small businesses lack the economic scale to offer inexpensive, convenient services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers in this income bracket tend to be the most frugal concerning vehicle repairs, often opting to complete less technical repairs themselves or seeking only essential repairs.

Consumers in this income bracket comprise the third-largest customer base in the industry. Consumers in this bracket have deeper pockets and tend not to hold off repairs, nonessential or otherwise, to their vehicles.

Although this segment comprises less than other income brackets, customers in this category often have the available per capita disposable income to spend on nonessential and essential windshield repairs.

These consumers often express the greatest demand for the industry's most profitable services. High-income earners possess the most discretionary income; they are the least likely to postpone repairs to their vehicles and are most likely to spend lavishly on value-added services.
Auto windshield repairers provide general repair and replacement services for businesses, alongside personalization services that include exterior work on company cars.
This segment includes federal, state and local governments alongside nonprofit organizations. Demand for repairs commonly includes emergency service and other government vehicles.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Windshield repair and replacement for cars
products_and_services.product_description: Windshield repair and replacement services for automobiles, trucks, buses and other vehicles. Companies also offer tinting and other discretionary services.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Windshield repair and replacement for light duty trucks
products_and_services.product_description: Light trucks include sport utility vehicles (SUVs), pickup trucks and panel trucks. Light trucks have a gross vehicle weight up to 8,500 pounds.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Windshield repair and replacement for heavy trucks, buses and miscellaneous vehicles
products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes windshield repair and replacement for heavy trucks, buses, motor homes and campers. Heavy trucks include box trucks, flatbeds, garbage trucks, mobile cranes and refrigerated trucks.

Auto windshield repair services also provide windshield replacement and repair services for motorcycles, trailers and industrial trucks. Some companies also retail related accessories and windshield care products to generate small revenue streams.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for car windshield repairs largely depends on the level of per capita disposable income and other external factors, like weather conditions, car sales, insurance coverage and vehicle mileage.
Regions prone to extreme temperatures, weather or disasters comprise a greater number of establishments.
Demand for windshield repair services is affected by car sales.
Demand is influenced by insurance coverage for windshield repairs.
Higher vehicle mileage increases the chances of windshield damage and need for repairs.

business_locations.location_description: California has the highest percentage of establishments at 11.0%

barriers_points.barrier_description: Entrants must obtain the necessary state and local permits, including licenses with consumer protection bureaus. Companies must also ensure installations meet safety standards.
Start-up costs include legal fees, building leases, tools and equipment. Most companies' capital expenditures are relatively low but can grow costly as a company expands.
Windshield repairers can differentiate with added services, like mobile repair, that provide buyers with greater convenience and cost savings. Fast response times can also help a company

factors_decreased_barrier: Provision of superior after sales service

basis_points.basis_title: Provision of superior after sales service
basis_points.basis_description: Windshield replacement companies that offer after sale services can attract ongoing patronage in this competitive market.

Windshields may require regular maintenance and repair, especially in regions with harsh or extreme weather conditions. Maintaining excellent customer relations can lead to repeat demand for services and referrals from loyal customers.

Having a good reputation is especially important in small regional markets, where customer referrals can account for a significant portion of new business. Companies that have a superior reputation can attract more demand from customers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Belron has a dominant position in the market
concentration_points.concentration_description: Belron, which operates in the domestic market as Safelite, comprises the largest share of the market. Safelite has captured more than 40.0% of the addressable market.
Beyond Belron, most repair services are nonemployers and small companies with fewer than five employees. The industry's structure lends itself to a large percentage of local providers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs are the second-largest expense for auto windshield repair services. Companies heavily rely on skilled technicians to provide superior services and generate strong reputations in local communities.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs can vary year-to-year due to input price fluctuations
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs primarily consist of window and windshield glass, repair equipment, materials and related tools. Repair shops can choose to use aftermarket and original equipment replacements. Purchase costs have marginally increased through the current period, largely driven by severe supply chain disruptions...

The end of pandemic-related restrictions caused demand to surge as individuals expressed pent-up demand for travel. Increased vehicle miles and more motor vehicle registrations led to significant wear and tear on vehicles, contributing to profit growth.

FAQs.question: What are some key financial benchmarks for the Auto Windshield Repair Services industry?
FAQs.answer: According to the report, some key financial benchmarks are: Profit margin of 13.2% (higher than sector average), average wage of $41,544 (lower than sector average), largest cost is wages at 23.3% of revenue. The industry is labor-intensive and relies on skilled technicians, facing volatile purchasing costs due to supply chain disruptions.

FAQs.question: What trends have impacted industry costs?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs have declined as a share of revenue due to minor automation and workforce consolidation during the pandemic. Purchase costs for materials like glass and equipment have increased due to supply chain disruptions and shortages. Profit has expanded from pent-up demand for travel and vehicle repairs after the pandemic.

FAQs.question: What are some key financial ratios and metrics provided?
FAQs.answer: The report provides data on ratios like EBIT/Revenue, EBITDA/Revenue, leverage ratio, taxes paid/revenue, liquidity ratios (current ratio, quick ratio), coverage ratios (interest coverage, debt service coverage), leverage ratios (debt/net worth), operating ratios (return on net worth/assets), and cash flow ratios over different time periods like 3-year, 5-year, 10-year. It also shows detailed income statement and balance sheet data.

FAQs.question: What industry trends are shown in the key ratios table?
FAQs.answer: The key ratios table shows trends in metrics like revenue per employee, revenue per enterprise, employees per establishment/enterprise, average wage, wages as a percentage of revenue, establishments per enterprise, and IVA (industry value added) as a percentage of revenue from 2005 to 2030 (projected). Most metrics have remained relatively stable over this period.
